'''Erie''' ({{pronEng|ËÉªÉri}}) is an industrial city on the shore of [[Lake Erie]] and the regional hub of northwestern [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. Named for the lake and the [[Erie tribe|Native American tribe]] that resided along its southern shore, Erie is the state's fourth largest [[city]] (after [[Philadelphia]], [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]] and [[Allentown, Pennsylvania|Allentown]]), with a population of 104,000.<ref name="county facts">{{cite web|publisher=Erie County Government|url=http://www.eriecountygov.org/default.aspx?id=rec&HeadlineID=394298488593750&Action=ShowArticle|title=Interesting Facts about Erie County|accessdate=2007-05-21}}</ref> Erie's Metropolitan Area consists of approximately 280,000 residents and an Urbanized Area population of approximately 195,000. The city is the [[county seat|seat of government]] for [[Erie County, Pennsylvania|Erie County]].
+
'''Erie''' ({{pronEng|ËÉªÉri}}) is a city on the shore of [[Lake Erie]] and the regional hub of northwestern [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. Named for the lake and the [[Erie tribe|Native American tribe]] that resided along its southern shore, Erie is the state's fourth largest [[city]] (after [[Philadelphia]], [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]] and [[Allentown, Pennsylvania|Allentown]]), with a population of 104,000.<ref name="county facts">{{cite web|publisher=Erie County Government|url=http://www.eriecountygov.org/default.aspx?id=rec&HeadlineID=394298488593750&Action=ShowArticle|title=Interesting Facts about Erie County|accessdate=2007-05-21}}</ref> Erie's Metropolitan Area consists of approximately 280,000 residents and an Urbanized Area population of approximately 195,000. The city is the [[county seat|seat of government]] for [[Erie County, Pennsylvania|Erie County]].
Erie is near [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]]; [[Buffalo, New York|Buffalo]], [[New York]]; and [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]], [[Pennsylvania]]. Once teeming with heavy industry, Erie's manufacturing sector remains prominent in the local economy, though healthcare, higher education, and tourism are emerging as greater economic drivers. Millions visit Erie for water recreation at [[Presque Isle State Park]], as well as attractions like a [[Presque Isle Downs|casino and horse racetrack]] named for the state park.
Erie is near [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]]; [[Buffalo, New York|Buffalo]], [[New York]]; and [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]], [[Pennsylvania]]. Once teeming with heavy industry, Erie's manufacturing sector remains prominent in the local economy, though healthcare, higher education, and tourism are emerging as greater economic drivers. Millions visit Erie for water recreation at [[Presque Isle State Park]], as well as attractions like a [[Presque Isle Downs|casino and horse racetrack]] named for the state park.
